Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should subsidize vocational education", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Vocational education will be too expensive and costly.<sep>Keypoint: Subsidizing vocational education is expensive
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that vocational education will be too expensive and costly.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Vocational education is key to getting more skilled workers,<sep>Keypoint: Vocational education is beneficial for the entire market/society
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that vocational education is key to getting more skilled workers,

Positive Examples.input: Argument: We should subsidize not vocational education because it trades off with more urgent needs the state can meet, like homeless shelters and food banks.<sep>Keypoint: Vocational education is not a good career choice
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that we should subsidize not vocational education because it trades off with more urgent needs the state can meet, like homeless shelters and food banks.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Vocation educational is limited in the skills being provided to youths. the teachings they get could be outdated in just a few years which will put the learners in unemployment<sep>Keypoint: Vocational education is not a good career choice
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that vocation educational is limited in the skills being provided to youths. the teachings they get could be outdated in just a few years which will put the learners in unemployment

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Vocational education helps students who don't do well in traditional education<sep>Keypoint: Vocational education is beneficial for the entire market/society
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that vocational education helps students who don't do well in traditional education

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Vocation educational works to reduce unemployment among less-educated youths. subsidizing it will get more youths to get jobs and develop the economy<sep>Keypoint: Vocational education better fits many students
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that vocation educational works to reduce unemployment among less-educated youths. subsidizing it will get more youths to get jobs and develop the economy
